questionTitle: Susan had had a special ________ with her aunt ever since her mother died.
The child was so noisy that his mother told him not to be such a ________.
I took ________ tennis again at the beginning of this year.
Would you ________ the stamps on to the envelope for me, please?
The robber ________ everyone in the bank lie on the floor before he escaped with the money.
There are ________ people who always cause trouble.
I am late because my alarm clock never ________ this morning.
In spite of her protests, her father ________ her train for the race three hours a day.
Eustace was standing ________ of the diving board, showing off his physique.
Stewart: Let's go and have lunch. Herbert: I mustn't stop ________ on this for another ten minutes.
Would you mind if I ________ the window?
It was wrong of you to talk to her like that - the next time you see her, you ________ apologize.
If he's not back ________ midnight, I'm going to phone the police.
He ________ his wife and children and left them to take care of themselves.
Henry ________ on complaining to the manager in person.
Trevor has a great ________ for Capri because he spent his honeymoon there.
Like Micawber, I hope ________ something better.
I would go to Cracow if I ________ time to do it.
Of course I'll play the piano at the party but I'm a little ________.
The coal is mined day ________ night by a system of shift work.
